snippet: A judge said the law placed an unreasonable burden on people trying to exercise their fundamental right to vote.
abstract: Pennsylvania State Judge Bernard L McGinley strikes down state's 2012 law requiring voters to produce a state-approved photo ID at the polls; move sets up potential Supreme Court confrontation that could have implications for other such laws across the country; ruling says law hampers ability of hundreds of thousands of Pennsylvanians to cast their ballots.
lead_paragraph: A judge said the law placed an unreasonable burden on people trying to exercise their fundamental right to vote.

headline.main: Pennsylvania Voter ID Law Struck Down as Judge Cites Burden on Citizens
headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania Voter ID Law Struck Down as Judge Cites Burden on Citizens
